About Tabletop Whale

The Author

Hi! My name's Eleanor Lutz and I write this blog. I'm a PhD student at the University of Washington studying biology. I work in Jeff Riffell's research lab looking at the inside of mosquito brains. You can find my CV here if you're interested.

I spend my free time cooking, reading, playing computer games, and dabbling in Python. Someday I want to write a science fiction book and visit Iceland.

How I Make Infographics

I make most of my infographics and charts in Photoshop and Illustrator. Here's a tutorial I made about the entire process. I try to be really transparent about my sources, and most of the infographics are based on reputable scientific sources like textbooks and peer-reviewed research papers. The website is a responsive Jekyll theme built from scratch and hosted on Github Pages.

Contact

Want to tell me about an awesome research study? Collaborate on an infographic? Ask me a question or leave a comment? Get in touch at tabletopwhale@outlook.com.

About Tabletop Whale

Tabletop Whale is a tiny blog run by a PhD student in Seattle. It's updated every few weeks with a science themed infographic, chart, or illustration.

Say Hi!

Questions? Comments? Feel free to shoot me an email or find me on Twitter. I also have accounts on Redbubble and Behance.
